data.name: A vitamin
suggestions: Take with a meal that contains healthy fats
Zinc supports vitamin A absorption

data.name: Berberine
suggestions: Divide into three doses taken before or with meals
Potential interactions with medications for diabetes, high blood pressure, or blood clotting

data.name: B1 vitamin
suggestions: Vitamin C-rich foods can enhance thiamine absorption
Potential interactions with chemotherapy drugs

data.name: B2 vitamin
benefits: Reducing the frequency and severity of migraine headaches
suggestions: Can interact with tetracycline antibiotics
Take with a meal that contains some fat for optimal absorption

data.name: B3 vitamin
benefits: Improves skin health by reducing inflammation
suggestions: Taking it with food can help prevent an upset stomach
Large doses might worsen gout

data.name: B5 vitamin
benefits: Support for the nervous system and brain health
Contributes to skin and hair health
suggestions: Potential interaction with renal function
It works well with hyaluronic acid for skin benefits

data.name: B6 vitamin
benefits: Healthy nervous system and brain function
suggestions: Take it in the morning on an empty stomach for optimal absorption
May help alleviate symptoms of premenstrual syndrome (PMS)

data.name: B7 vitamin
benefits: Support hair, skin, and nail health
Potentially alleviates symptoms like brain fog and depression
suggestions: Can interfere with laboratory blood tests for hormones like thyroid-stimulating hormone
Antibiotics may reduce beneficial intestinal bacteria that produce biotin

data.name: B9 vitamin
benefits: Vital for the formation of red blood cells and DNA
suggestions: Absorbed more efficiently when consumed with a meal
Oral contraceptives can reduce B9 levels

data.name: B12 vitamin
benefits: Maintaining the health of your nervous system
suggestions: Take in the morning, ideally on an empty stomach
Avoid taking B12 close to bedtime, as it may interfere with melatonin production

data.name: Caffeine
benefits: Can improve mood and brain function
May aid in weight management by stimulating metabolism and increasing fat burning
suggestions: May interact with psychiatric medications
Can reduce the effectiveness of certain medications used for hypothyroidism and osteoporosis drugs

data.name: Calcium
benefits: Help lower the risk of developing high blood pressure
suggestions: Split larger daily doses into smaller doses throughout the day
May interact with certain blood pressure medications

data.name: Chondroitin
suggestions: Take with a meal to reduce the risk of stomach discomfort
May worsen asthma symptoms in some individuals

data.name: Citrulline
suggestions: Take it about an hour before exercise
Interaction with medications that affect blood pressure or blood flow

data.name: Coenzyme Q10
benefits: Reducing fasting glucose and insulin levels
suggestions: Take with a meal containing healthy fats to maximize absorption
Statin drugs, used for cholesterol, can deplete CoQ10 levels in the body

data.name: Creatine
benefits: Enhanced muscle growth and exercise performance
Improves memory, attention and information processing speed
suggestions: Taking it close to your workout—either before or after, with a meal
Chronic caffeine consumption may reduce some of creatine’s benefits

data.name: C vitamin
benefits: Promoting collagen production for skin health
suggestions: Take first thing in the morning, 30 to 45 minutes before a meal, or two hours after eating
Might diminish the beneficial effects of niacin when taken together

data.name: D vitamin
suggestions: Take with a meal that contains healthy fats
Fat tissue can sequester vitamin D, lowering its serum levels

data.name: E vitamin
suggestions: Take with a meal containing fat
Acts as a blood thinner, inhibits anticoagulants and can increase the risk of bleeding

data.name: Ginkgo
benefits: Improve blood flow to the brain, eyes, ears, and legs
suggestions: Take it in the morning
May interact with medications used to treat seizures

data.name: Glucosamine
benefits: Antioxidant effects that improve eye health
suggestions: Take it consistently, with meals
May interfere with the effectiveness of certain chemotherapy drugs

data.name: Glutamine
suggestions: Take on an empty stomach
Not recommended for individuals with end-stage liver or kidney diseases, cancer or bipolar disorder

data.name: Iodine
suggestions: Take with food to minimize potential stomach upset
Can worsen thyroid disorders such as hypothyroidism, goiter, or thyroid tumors

data.name: Iron
suggestions: In the morning on an empty stomach
Can interact with drugs that reduce stomach acid

data.name: K vitamin
suggestions: Take with a meal containing fat to maximize absorption
Can interact with antacids, antibiotics, aspirin, drugs for cancer and seizures

data.name: Magnesium
suggestions: Taking it with food is advised for most types to reduce the risk of side effects like diarrhea
High doses of zinc can hinder magnesium absorption

data.name: Melatonin
suggestions: Take 1 to 2 hours before bedtime
May lower blood glucose levels when taken with diabetes medications

data.name: NAC
benefits: Improve sperm quality and motility and enhance ovulation
suggestions: Taken in the morning on an empty stomach may maximize glutathione production
Taken in the evening can be advantageous for promoting relaxation, supporting overnight recovery

data.name: Omega-3
benefits: Support cognitive function and improve memory
suggestions: Take with a meal containing dietary fat, as this improves absorption
Have antithrombotic effect, which can increase the risk of bleeding

data.name: Omega-6
benefits: Can reduce the risk of heart attacks
disease: Not recommended for any specific disease
suggestions: Just before or after a meal such as lunch or dinner, to improve nutrient absorption
May interact with drugs like aspirin, ibuprofen

data.name: Potassium
benefits: Supports nerve signal transmission and muscle contraction
suggestions: Take with meals or shortly after eating, to minimize stomach irritation
Medications that can cause low potassium include diuretics, insulin (especially in high doses), antimicrobials (penicillin)

data.name: Quercetin
benefits: Prevents the oxidation of lipids that contribute to plaque buildup in arteries
suggestions: Take with a meal containing healthy fats, ideally breakfast or dinner
May interact with medications used for diabetes (can lower blood sugar levels) and high blood pressure

data.name: Resveratrol
benefits: Improves insulin sensitivity and lowers blood glucose
suggestions: Take in the evening support sleep quality and cellular repair
Has mild estrogen-like effects, and may be of concern for individuals with hormone-sensitive conditions, including certain cancers

data.name: Selenium
suggestions: Splitting a higher dose between morning and evening can help maintain steady levels
Can interact with immunosuppressants, possibly reducing their effectiveness

data.name: Turmeric
benefits: Can aid in weight management for people with diabetes
suggestions: Turmeric's active compound, curcumin, is fat-soluble and poorly absorbed on an empty stomach, so take with meal that contains healthy fats
Can interact with a wide range of medications, those affecting blood clotting, blood sugar, cancer treatment, and liver metabolism

data.name: Zinc
suggestions: Take on an empty stomach, either one hour before a meal or two hours after eating
Can interacts with several classes of antibiotics, reducing the effectiveness
